title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Thursday 24 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: tern hill barracks site put up for sale .
about 550 homes could have flooded this winter but for defences , experts says .
farmer plants 170,000 daffodils in a field to raise money for charity .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for shropshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 tuesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: weather : a wet evening , but cloud clearing up by dawn
text: it 's going to be a rainy evening for some of us , but the clouds should clear away by dawn .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: market drayton residents consider mod sell-off
text: people living in market drayton say they 're disappointed and shocked at news tern hill barracks is to close , but some say extra housing , if affordable , would be a welcome use for the site .
others questioned the effect it would have on infrastructure and the ability of the town to support up to 600 extra families
`` there 's no more work in the town , so pretty much it 's just going to have a negative effect , '' one person told bbc radio shropshire .

documents.title: mayor hopes for change in mod policy
text: market drayon 's mayor roy aldcroft says the closure of tern hill barracks as part of a wider mod sell-off will have a big `` emotional and economic effect '' on the town .
the 1st battalion has been based there since 2007 , although the barracks themselves date back about 100 years .
mr aldcroft said the royal irish troops had `` woven themselves into the fabric of the town '' and hoped for a change of policy on the part of the mod .
the government says the site will be sold off for housing .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury out for revenge against port vale
text: shrewsbury have a score to settle against port vale after their listless performance in a 2-0 away defeat in october - one of their worst defeats of the season .
but now the side is unbeaten in its last eight league games and looking good to avoid relegation , and manager micky mellon wants to show port vale a different and improved '' shrewsbury .
town 's new loan signing from wigan , jack hendry ( is in line for an immediate debut in defence .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: campaigners fail to raise £ 300,000 to buy threatened kinnerley pub
text: a community 's bid to take over its pub has failed .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: loss of base will have big 'emotional and economic ' impact on market drayton
text: the mayor of market drayton says the news that the clive barracks are going to close is `` deeply upsetting '' .
the base has been home to the first battalion of the royal irish regiment since 2007
town mayor roy aldcroft said : `` we 've developed really good relations with all the regiments who have been there , especially the royal irish regiment .
we 've got to know their families , we 've got to know their children . ''
mr aldcroft said the closure of the base and the loss of the battalion would have a `` significant economic impact on the town '' as well as an `` emotional '' one .
he said there would be talks between the town council , shropshire council and the mod about the prospect of 600 homes being built there .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather warning for region
text: not great weather expected this bank holiday weekend - the met office issues a warning for high winds .
yellow alert of wind for west midlands : shropshire , staffordshire , stoke-on-trent , telford and wrekin , herefo

documents.title: headlines : clive barracks to close ; delays expected for rail users
text: these are our top stories this evening :
- clive barracks to close and 600 homes could be built on site
- delays expected for rail users travelling east over easter
- pontesbury woman plants 170,000 daffodils to raise money for charity
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: up to 600 homes could be built on barracks site
text: the mod says the whole clive barracks site is up for sale and it believes there is space there for 600 homes .
ultimately though , it says the decision on what to do with the site would be down to the purchaser .
it says the aim is to sell the site by 2020 .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail works to impact commuters over easter and beyond
text: if you 're taking the train to birmingham over easter , you can expect delays because work to replace a rail junction is over-running .
network rail says engineers are completing a `` big piece of work '' between wolverhampton and birmingham that wo n't now be completed until next wednesday .
journey times will increase by up to 30 minutes , while replacement coaches between the cities will take one hour .

documents.title: mp says closure of clive barracks 'very sad '
text: the news that the clive barracks at tern hill are to close , as part of an mod sell-off , has been described as `` very sad '' by the mp for north shropshire , owen paterson .
he said the first battalion of the royal irish regiment , which has been based there since 2007 , is very popular in the market drayton area .
and he said it was sad for the constituency as a whole .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royal irish regiment looking for a new home
text: when the clive barracks at tern hill are sold , the first battalion of the royal irish regiment will be looking for a new home .
it 's been based there since 2007 and does n't yet know where its troops will move to .
soldiers were given the news today .
the closure of the base is also likely to have a big impact on the economy of market drayton .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ludlow hospital supporters raise over £ 100,000 in a year
text: ludlow hospital 's league of friends says it 's raised more than £ 100,000 for equipment in the last year .
in that time it 's paid for an ultrasound scanner , a soundproof booth for audiology and sophisticated ophthalmology equipment .
the group says it 's important the hospital has the most appropriate and up-to-date facilities , to provide as much care as possible , closer to home .

documents.title: bungie jumping for georgia williams trust
text: it 's georgia williams day at new college in wellington today and people have been taking part in a bungie jump to raise money for the georgia williams trust .
the charity was set up to help young people in the area to get involved in outdoor activities .
first bungee jump of the day !
@ twitterid

documents.title: headlines : barracks site up for sale ; flood defences protected 550 properties
text: these are our top stories this afternoon :
- land at clive barracks put up for sale
- flood defences 'protected 550 properties in shropshire this winter '
- medieval gate restored in shrewsbury
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingtern hill barracks site up for sale
text: land at the clive barracks at tern hill is being sold off for housing .
it is currently home to a battalion of the royal irish regiment , and is one of 10 mod sites around the country being sold to build a total of 7,000 new homes .
the government says the sales could to raise £ 140m .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury renamed for easter story
text: churches in shrewsbury have been marking the week leading up top easter in a creative way .
they 've superimposed a map of ancient jerusalem over a map of the town , so they can imagine how the locations in the easter story were connected to one another .
so for instance radbrook becomes gethsemane and longden road becomes golgotha .
and all this week there have been events in the morning and the evening , with readings and an explanation of what happened in each biblical location .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: farmer plants daffodil field to raise money for charity
text: a pontesbury farmer has planted 170,000 daffodils in a field to raise money for marie curie cancer care .
jane halton-harrop used a machine to plant all the bulbs in september and hopes that once they settle in , they will multiply .
and she has left yellow labels and a pen , so that if you 've lost someone special to you , you can leave a message and tie it to a fence .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: mounted police return for shrewsbury vs port vale match
text: mounted police will be travelling over from the thames valley force to help control crowds at the shrewsbury town vs port vale game tomorrow .
the match is all-ticket for the vale fans , but shrewsbury supporters can pay on the day .
with traffic around the ground expected to be busy the police are asking fans to arrive early and are warning late-comers may be refused entry .
as with any football match where a large crowd is expected , there can be disruption on our roads and in the local area .
through our strategic planning , and work with the club we will be do all we can to minimise the impact on the local community . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: asda superstore evacuated over burnt toast
text: an entire asda superstore was evacuated this morning after toast was burnt in the staff canteen .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: coming up on tv : easter travel warning
text: about 11 million cars are expected to take to the roads as the easter holiday getaway begins .
the aa has warned that it 's likely to be worse than last year and roads in the west midlands could be among the busiest .
highways england is lifting more than 58 miles of major roadworks across the region to help ease congestion .
more on midlands today , from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Sarah Falkland
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shropshire e-cigarette seller warns of modification kids
text: some modification kits which you can buy online to alter your e-cigarette `` are n't worth the risk '' a wellington shopkeeper is warning .
the kits can allow the devices to hold more liquid , produce more vapour or charge quicker , among other things .
but mike hannah , who manages the puff in peace chain in shropshire , says people need to beware buying second hand kits or cheap imitations of popular brands .
you can buy second hand .
personally i would n't .
you do n't know what it 's been through and you do n't know its past life you do n't know if they are made properly and set properly for the type of battery . ''

documents.title: video : the restored traitor 's gate in shrewsbury
text: traitor 's gate in shrewsbury can be found at the bottom of st mary 's water lane and that lane was originally flanked by defensive walls leading up to a second gate in the main town walls .

it 's been restored recently and the conservationists found the rear of the gate was rebuilt in early brick , perhaps by royalists during the english civil war.. you can see the brickwork in this video .
there is a story that a traitor opened the gate to a force of parliamentarian troops in february 1645 , allowing them to take control of the town .
and that 's why it 's known as traitor 's gate .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : hundreds of properties protected by flood defences ; warning over e-cig mod kits
text: these are our headlines this lunchtime :
- 550 properties in the county protected by flood defences this winter
- warning over some e-cig modification kits
- medieval gate in shrewsbury restored
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ice hockey : weaver determined to make up for last season 's disappointment
text: losing in the play-offs to peterborough last season is motivating the telford tigers to try harder this year .
they face milton keynes across two legs on saturday and sunday with a place in the final four the prize for the winner .
veteran defenceman jonathan weaver says even though they won the league last season , defeat in the play-off semi-final ended things on a negative note .
it kind of left a bitter taste in our mouths .
we 'd had a good season and take nothing away from peterborough , as they deserved it , but we let ourselves down .
we did n't play like we had done all season and there 's certainly a few guys who want to right that wrong . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : rain likely in shropshire this afternoon
text: we 'll be getting rain , some of it heavy , in shropshire this afternoon .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: warning of more protests from shropshire farmers
text: shropshire farmers may stage further protests , to highlight what they see as the troubles facing them .
yesterday dozens joined a demonstration in london .
these farmers say if they do n't take direct action , no one will listen to them .
no one understands just how bad things have got .
and they believe there 's little prospect of the next 12 months being much better .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: oswestry 's mile end visitor information centre to close 'as soon as possible '
text: three part-time jobs will also go after shropshire council 's cabinet agreed to proposals to redesign visitor information centres across north shropshire .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: shrewsbury town 's top scorer should play for england , says manager
text: why is sullay kaikai not playing for the england under-21s this weekend ?
kaikai 's in the crystal palace first-team squad , but is currently on loan at shrewsbury town , where he 's hit four goals in the last three games and is the side 's top scorer with nine .
shrewsbury 's manager micky mellon says the english international selectors need to wake up to the talent right in front of them .
`` tell me who 's better than him in that under-21 team ? ''
asked mellon .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury 's traitor 's gate restored
text: a hidden 13th century gate in shrewsbury has been restored , but historic england warns that other stretches of the old town walls remain at risk .
the work on traitor 's gate , also known as st mary 's water gate , has seen ivy removed , as well as stone and brickwork repaired - at a cost of £ 6,000 .
the gate was used to provide access to the town from the river severn .

documents.title: defences protected 550 buildings during winter floods
text: the environment agency says around 550 homes and businesses in shropshire would have flooded over the winter , if it was n't for the flood defences in the county .

shrewsbury and ironbridge both have barriers which can be erected if high river levels are expected and there are also the argaes ( which is the welsh for bank or dam ) around the severn and vyrnwy in the north of the county .
the environment agency says that across the severn and wye catchments in the wider midlands area 7,200 homes were protected .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: muddy race for life at weston park next month
text: weston park is staging a 10k run with a twist next month - because it includes an obstacle course with scramble nets , tunnels , hurdles and lots of mud !
cancer research uk is organising the race for life pretty muddy event on 30 april .

one of the women taking part is 26-year-old susan jesse from telford , who is doing the run with a group of friends ( above ) to support her mother anne stuart , who had treatment for a cancer on her tongue .
about 18 of us did it at weston park last year and really loved it .
we wore tutus and pink eyelashes , and could n't believe they stayed on even when we were covered in mud from head to toe . ''

documents.title: headlines : warning on modified e-cigs ; farmers threaten more protests
text: these are our top stories this morning :
- shropshire company warns of the dangers of buying modified e-cigarettes
- dairy farmers threaten more protests over milk prices
- 'confused ' horse rider taken to hospital after fall
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: works in ironbridge suspended ahead of easter visitors
text: work has been under way for a few weeks to upgrade the paving along the wharfage and tontine hill .
the current yorkstone paving is being replaced with a type of clay block .
this weekend , all traffic management in place during the works will be taken away giving visitors easy access to the wharfage over the easter break .
the work will start up again on tuesday 29 march .
author: Sam Fleet
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: capability brown anniversary celebrations
text: `` i have n't finished england yet '' , came the reply when capability brown was asked to design gardens in ireland .
this year marks 300 years since his birth and events are happening all over the country to celebrate .
the landscape around weston park near the staffordshire border was created by capability brown .
they have a spring walk next month and an exhibition from the embroider 's guild , which you can see over the easter weekend .
author: Jim Hawkins Show

documents.title: ellesmere man found 'wandering and confused ' after falling off a horse
text: a horse rider has been airlifted to hospital after being discovered in a `` confused state '' wandering in the criftins area near ellesmere .
the 51-year-old , who was wearing a helmet and body protection , is thought to have hit his head when falling off his horse .
he was found yesterday lunchtime and was anaesthetised before being flown to the royal stoke university hospital .

documents.title: e-cigarettes : a danger or an aid to quitting ?
text: the popularity of e-cigarettes has increased massively in the last few years and there are now 40 shops in shropshire that sell them .
a telford man has undergone several operations after a modified one exploded in his mouth .
the british medical association say the long-term effects of them are n't known .
are they a gateway into or out of smoking ?
more with eric smith and clare ashford on bbc radio shropshire breakfast this morning .
author: Eric and Clare's Breakfast Show

documents.title: headlines : telford man has gone through 'hell ' after exploding e-cigarette ; shropshire farmers may protest again
text: the top stories this morning :
- a telford man says he 's been through `` hell and back '' after a modified e-cigarette exploded in his face
- shropshire farmers may stage further protests - to highlight what they see as the troubles facing them
- a man 's been flown to hospital in stoke after falling off a horse near ellesmere
author: Sam Fleet
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a cloudy but dry start with rain later
text: here 's sara blizzard with the latest forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : no major problems on the roads so far
text: roadworks are dotted about the county 's towns so do take care through temporary traffic lights .
there 's more information on the travel map .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm in the bbc shropshire newsroom this morning , bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
send us your photos or get in touch by email , tweet or the facebook page .
author: Sam Fleet
Journalist, BBC Shropshire
